sentences.sContent: We were driving along Follyfoot Road.
sentences.sCn: 我们沿着福莱福特路行驶。

sentences.sContent: She glanced anxiously along the line of faces.
sentences.sCn: 她焦急地扫视着这一排面孔。

sentences.sContent: He slid his hand along her arm.
sentences.sCn: 他的手顺着她的臂膀滑下。

sentences.sContent: ...I could get along well with classmates and have good cooperation with other members during work...
...the local people built homes and fairs along the river...
...I could get along well with my friends and have good cooperation with other members during work...
...Somewhere along the way I set aside my hopes of writing that flawless essay...
...our goal must be to respect differences among people in order to get along successfully with our global neighbors...
...The National School Lunch Act requires that school lunches go along with the Dietary Guidelines for Americans developed by the government...
...You can walk in parks or along a river or in your neighborhood...
...along with their ability to attract the best talent...
...like getting to work on time and getting along with a team...

phrases.pCn: 沿（顺）着；连同…一起；与…一道；随同…一起
（勉强）生活；进展；（使）前进；与…和睦相处
v. 出现；一起来；陪伴；进步
沽名钓誉的；(在团体中)图虚名而不做工作的；逢场作戏；陪伴
在那个方向，朝那个方向
在这个方向，朝这个方向

trans.tranOther: from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it
